alert.note: Alert for Harrison; Monona (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 30 at 9:38PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Monona, northwestern Harrison, southeastern Burt and north central Washington Counties through 1015 PM CDT... At 938 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 3 miles northwest of Herman, or 5 miles southwest of Tekamah, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Little Sioux around 955 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Pisgah and Blencoe. This includes Interstate 29 between mile markers 89 and 107. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
